channel.title: VB Net 2008 Game
channel.description:
I made a game in VB net 2008. It's called "Toy Tycoon".
The point of the game is to be a succesful toy seller and to get 1 million money. You can buy a warehouse, a factory and a shop. There is also a shop where you can buy materials to make toys.
The warehouse is where all the toys you made go to. You can ship them from the warehouse to the shop for 100 money. It will take 1 minute.
The shop is used to sell your toys. A messagebox will appear when it is sold. You will also (ofcourse) get money for it.
The factory is used to produce toys. It will take 1 minute to produce one train (currently only available toy). The game will inform you when it's done.
There is also a save and load option. Just press "Save" before you exit the program, and the next time you open the program you can load from the point you saved.
Game in attachment.

item.title: VB Net 2008 Game
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

[quote=“someone2, post:40, topic:381334”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=477147.msg3496875#msg3496875 date=1297388494]

lool looks like something a 7 year old would make

I don’t know how many times I have to say it’s still under construction.

I already changed the background. Changed fonts. Added a splashscreen and tutorial. Also added a exit game button. And if it looks like something a 7 year old would make, then why don’t you make something like that with all the strings, the save and load button and the timers etc. in vb net 2008 in 2 days?
[/quote]Why would you say in 2 days? It could easily be done in less…

You remind me of how I was a few months ago…

It took me like idk 10-20 minutes? I only was too lazy to put it here, lol.[/quote]

someone2:

It took me 2 days to make it

Read full topic

Making this game taught me a lot of things about visual basic net 2008 too. But oh well, I think continuing on my 3D game now is a better idea. I have to model a lot of things too now.[/quote]

item.title: VB Net 2008 Game
item.dc:creator: @someone2 someone2
item.description:
@someone2 wrote:

VbCoder:

Don’t lie, you aren’t creating a 3D game

I indeed am not, but I am modding one. A huge mod. Currently like this game just has a few options, a few things, like 10 or something, to build and like 100 items?

Now I’m adding A LOT of more buildings, also A LOT of more items. I’ll change the textures, make new icons etc. etc. This will take a very long time, but I’m still gonna do it. All the new buildings etc. I’m going to add are modelled 100% by me. I already added one.

@ pure2ownage
As a beginner not knowing anything about vb net 2008?

Read full topic
